subject: Gardening
title: The Secret Garden: Fiction's Healing Power
description: One-minute skill: The Secret Garden: Fiction's Healing Power.

hook.text: Frances Hodgson Burnett's 'The Secret Garden' (1911) is about healing through gardening.

buildup.text: Two sickly children restore an abandoned gardenâ€”and in doing so, restore their own health and spirits.

discovery.text: The book popularized the idea that nature heals body and mindâ€”decades before horticultural therapy had a name.

twist.text: Burnett wrote from experience. She designed gardens at her estates and called gardening her main source of wellbeing.

climax.text: Fiction sometimes teaches medicine before science confirms it. The Secret Garden prescribed nature therapy early.

punchline.text: A children's novel prescribed garden therapy a century early.

quiz.question: Why is 'The Secret Garden' significant to horticultural therapy?
options: It was the first academic paper published on therapeutic gardening
It popularized nature-as-healing decades before horticultural therapy was formalized
It provided the medical protocols still used in garden therapy today
